title: Why can't you search trinkets by color?
body: I want to type in red and find the red trinket please.

replies.body: oh! i think that's something i can do pretty quickly/easilyâ€”i'll look into that sometime today.

Sort of in the same vein, could we add quick keywords for item types? Basically, what I wish I could do is just type "cdr" in to the search bar and be able to see all the items that give CDR, or "hp" and get likewise. Yes, I know there are catagories on the bottom, but I honestly find them a little tedious to deal with. It doesn't reset the next time you enter the store, so you have to go back and uncheck all the stuff you had before, and I just don't ever have the need to use the list often enough for the order of categories to be stuck in my brain.

Just a little gripe of mine.
Why can't buying another trinket simply replace the current one.
THIS. They're free, anyways, so why not?
Why does Rengar have access to standard trinkets if there is no reason to do so? Players that don't know how you need to buy Bonetooth Necklace will be playing without a passive.

Because there are hypothetical cases (level 9, insufficient stacks) where an upgraded standard trinket is preferable to a bone necklace. Say if the enemy team has a fed Akali or something. It's definitely not a common situation but in the rare case it does come up, why take away the option?
It might mean he at least makes *some* sort of trade for having BTN, instead of this weird trinket-slot wad of free thoughtless scaling power.

It's not really "free" in any sense though. It's his passive. If it's too strong, tune it down, but it's just a part of the champion like any other ability.

It is a bit odd that Rengar got his optional item trinket-ified while Viktor's mandatory item still isn't though.

As for it being a ball of stats, well, I for one was pretty bummed when they didn't keep the unique Rengar ward-traps thing they were doing. How that affects power I don't know but I thought it was far more interesting.

Except he still as a passive. He has a passive *and* the usual champ scaling *and* a decent kit *and* that free chunk of power sitting in his trinket slot. I'm not calling him OP, but his design is just bonkers.
This would be a nice improvement.  Currently I always find swapping trinkets a little awkward because I *think* of them by color and thus need to stop and think before searching for one.
